meanings.text: to stupefy with excess of light, with a blow, with cold, or with fear; to confuse; to benumb
To stupefy with excess of light; with a blow, with cold, or with fear; to confuse; to benumb
to stupefy with excess of light; with a blow, with cold, or with fear; to confuse; to benumb

examples.first: La tecnología láser, como la utilizada para "encandilar" o "cegar" a los satélites es prolífica y de difícil seguimiento, aunque el empleo de este arma no es de gran utilidad.
examples.second: Laser technology, such as that for ‘dazzling’ and ‘blinding’ satellites, is prolific and difficult to monitor, although there is no great utility in using such weapons.

examples.first: Intenta encandilar a cada mujer que conoce
examples.second: Try to charm every woman who known

examples.first: Para realizar esta singular vocación al amor, es preciso que no os dejéis encandilar por la sabiduría mundana, pues sólo a los pequeños revela el Padre sus misterios, entrando en su corazón, que, según una hermosa expresión de santa Clara de Asís, es «mansio et sedes», «morada y sede» de la divina Majestad (cf.
examples.second: To fulfil this exceptional vocation to love it is essential not to let oneself be dazzled by worldly wisdom; only to the little ones, in fact, did the Father reveal his mysteries, entering their hearts, which according to a lovely expression of St Clare of Assisi are the "mansio et sedes", the "dwelling place and abode" of the divine Majesty (cf.

examples.first: Se decía que Fauntroy desde su cargo podía persuadir a cualquiera o encandilar a cualquier mujer.
examples.second: It is said that John Ambrose Fauntroy could persuade any colleague from his position or charm any woman from her dress.

examples.first: “La perla del Pacífico” le encandilará. Sus privilegiadas playas...
examples.second: Its privileged beaches, ideal for bathing and many sea-related activities...

examples.first: Debemos exigir a nuestros propios gobiernos que no se dejen encandilar por las expectativas de buenos contactos comerciales, dejando a un segundo plano los derechos humanos.
examples.second: We have to demand of our own governments that they do not allow themselves to be dazzled by the prospect of good business contacts, so that human rights fade out of the picture.

examples.first: Y una oportunidad para las audiencias Jacobinas de encandilar a los extranjeros, especialmente a los hipócritas italianos.
examples.second: And an opportunity for Jacobean audiences to gawp at foreigners, especially the duplicitous Italians.

examples.first: Un hombre digno de admiración y capaz de hacer las más increíbles proezas para encandilar a mí querida esposa.
examples.second: A man you will admire, able to make a four at the flip of the wrist to support my lovely bride!

examples.first: Esto va de encandilar a las masas con chucherías.
examples.second: This is about dazzling the masses with a bauble.

examples.first: Este hotel boutique le encandilará con su decoración antigua, elaborada cuidando todos los detalles, y su impecable servicio. Déjese llevar por el ambiente de Broadway alojándose en este establecimiento.
examples.second: This boutique hotel charms guests with its genuine antique décor and careful attention to detail.

examples.first: La tecnología láser, como la utilizada para "encandilar" o "cegar" a los satélites es prolífica y de difícil seguimiento, aunque el empleo de este arma no es de gran utilidad
examples.second: Laser technology, such as that for `dazzling' and `blinding' satellites, is prolific and difficult to monitor, although there is no great utility in using such weapons

examples.first: Eso sirve para encandilar a sus negros que les gustan las rubias... y como en Nápoles no hay rubias, nosotros hemos creado el truco.
examples.second: In Naples, it's hard to find blonde women... We made that up...

examples.first: Pero no hay nada mejor para encandilar a una mujer que una buena acción.
examples.second: But there's nothing that turns a woman's heart to butter like a good deed.

examples.first: No puedes encandilar a los robots.
examples.second: You can't charm the robots.

examples.first: No son escasos los religiosos que, con un simplista rechazo de la modernidad, se dejan encandilar por un movimiento filosófico que se ha autoproclamado "post-modernidad" y que es mucho más contrario a la fe cristiana de lo que pudo serlo la "modernidad" bajo no importa cuáles de sus expresiones.
examples.second: How many empty words in our days, in writings called "religious", where the modern world is judged out of hand as evil and corrupt and where the religious present themselves as a counter-culture, or as an evangelical substitute for the surrounding culture ! The history of religious institutes, and especially of christian monasticism for almost two thousand years, shows that each time there has been a moment of great creativity or of renewal of a particular quality, it has been when a group of men or women were particularly present to the culture of their time, and were able to give in their life a response to the deepest aspirations of the men and women of their time, which had become their own aspirations.

examples.first: Pero no hay nada mejor para encandilar a una mujer que una buena acciòn
examples.second: But there' s nothing that turns a woman ' s heart to butter like a good deed

examples.first: Este hotel urbano le encandilará con su original decoración y lujosos interiores.
examples.second: This city hotel will win you over with its design, its individuality and its luxurious interior.

examples.first: Estate lista para encandilar, querida.
examples.second: Get ready to charm, darling.

examples.first: Cómo encandilar a una hoja de arce.
examples.second: How to bedazzle a maple leaf.

examples.first: El espejo que usted menciona debía servir para encandilar a la presa.
examples.second: Well, the mirror you mention would have been to dazzle the prey.
